c74object.name: dada.analysis.count
c74object.description: Counts the items of a score.

outlet.description: Outputs the number of the counted items (see arguments).

objarg.name: item_type
objarg.description: Sets the type of the items to be counted. Could be one of the following symbols: "notes", "chords", "measures", "voices".

method.name: bang
method.description: Outputs the result of the analysis performed on the most recently received input data.

method.name: llll
method.description: An llll in the first inlet is considered as a bach.roll or bach.score gathered syntax on which the analysis should be performed. The result is then output through the outlet.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

entry.name: Outlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: Item count. Outputs the number of the counted items (see arguments).
